de.mrapp.android.preference

Class ListPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractDialogPreference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.ListPreference

  • public class ListPreference
extends AbstractDialogPreference
    A preference, which allows to select a value from a list. The selected value will immediately persisted and the preference's dialog will become closed.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ListPreference.SavedState
      A data structure, which allows to save the internal state of an ListPreference.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListPreference

        public ListPreference(Context context)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context

      • ListPreference

        public ListPreference(Context context,
              AttributeSet attributeSet)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet

      • ListPreference

        public ListPreference(Context context,
              AttributeSet attributeSet,
              int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • ListPreference

        public ListPreference(Context context,
              AttributeSet attributeSet,
              int defaultStyle,
              int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

    • Method Detail

      • getEntries

        public final CharSequence[] getEntries()
        Returns the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Returns:
        The entries of the list, which is shown by the preference, as a CharSequence array or null, if no entries have been set

      • setEntries

        public final void setEntries(CharSequence[] entries)
        Sets the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        entries - The entries, which should be set, as an CharSequence array or null, if no entries should be set

      • setEntries

        public final void setEntries(int resourceId)
        Sets the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of entries, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource

      • getEntryValues

        public final CharSequence[] getEntryValues()
        Returns the values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Returns:
        The values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference, as a CharSequence array

      • setEntryValues

        public final void setEntryValues(CharSequence[] entryValues)
        Sets the values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        entryValues - The values, which should be set, as a CharSequence array or null, if no values should be set. The array's length must be equal to the number of list items

      • setEntryValues

        public final void setEntryValues(int resourceId)
        Sets the values, which correspond to the entries of the list, which is shown by the preference.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the values, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource. The array's length must be equal to the number of list items

      • getValue

        public final String getValue()
        Returns currently persisted value of the preference.
        Returns:
        The currently persisted value of the preference as a String

      • setValue

        public final void setValue(String value)
        Sets the current value of the preference. By setting a value, it will be persisted.
        Parameters:
        value - The value, which should be set, as a String

      • setValueIndex

        public final void setValueIndex(int index)
        Sets the current value of the preference. By setting a value, it will be persisted.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the value, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • getEntry

        public final CharSequence getEntry()
        Returns the entry, the currently persisted value of the preference belongs to.
        Returns:
        The entry, the currently persisted value of the preference belongs to, as an instance of the class CharSequence

      • getSummary

        public final CharSequence getSummary()
